document_notes.text:
This update for python fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2024-11168: Fixed improper validation of IPv6 and IPvFuture addresses (bsc#1233307)                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Other fixes:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
- Add ipaddress module from https://github.com/phihag/ipaddress                                                                                                                                                                                                               
- Remove -IVendor/ from python-config (bsc#1231795)                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
- Stop using %%defattr, it seems to be breaking proper executable                                                                                                                                                                                                             
  attributes on /usr/bin/ scripts (bsc#1227378).

notes.text: The urllib.parse.urlsplit() and urlparse() functions improperly validated bracketed hosts (`[]`), allowing hosts that weren't IPv6 or IPvFuture. This behavior was not conformant to RFC 3986 and potentially enabled SSRF if a URL is processed by more than one URL parser.
